name: MedicationDispense
description: Indicates that a medication product is to be or has been dispensed for a named person/patient.  This includes a description of the medication product (supply) provided and the instructions for administering the medication.  The medication dispense is the result of a pharmacy system responding to a medication order.

properties.name: MedicationDispense
properties.short: Dispensing a medication to a named patient
properties.definition: Indicates that a medication product is to be or has been dispensed for a named person/patient.  This includes a description of the medication product (supply) provided and the instructions for administering the medication.  The medication dispense is the result of a pharmacy system responding to a medication order.

properties.name: id
properties.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
properties.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

properties.name: meta
properties.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

properties.name: implicitRules
properties.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
properties.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
properties.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

properties.name: language
properties.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
properties.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

properties.name: text
properties.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
properties.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
properties.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

properties.name: contained
properties.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
properties.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

properties.name: extension
properties.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: modifierExtension
properties.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: identifier
properties.definition: Identifiers associated with this Medication Dispense that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
properties.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier.

properties.name: partOf
properties.short: Event that dispense is part of
properties.definition: The procedure that trigger the dispense.

properties.name: status
properties.short: preparation | in-progress | cancelled | on-hold | completed | entered-in-error | stopped | declined | unknown
properties.definition: A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events.
properties.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

properties.name: statusReason[x]
properties.short: Why a dispense was not performed
properties.definition: Indicates the reason why a dispense was not performed.

properties.name: category
properties.definition: Indicates the type of medication dispense (for example, where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered (i.e. inpatient or outpatient)).
properties.comment: The category can be used to include where the medication is expected to be consumed or other types of dispenses.  Invariants can be used to bind to different value sets when profiling to bind.

properties.name: medication[x]
properties.definition: Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
properties.comment: If only a code is specified, then it needs to be a code for a specific product. If more information is required, then the use of the medication resource is recommended.  For example, if you require form or lot number, then you must reference the Medication resource.

properties.name: subject
properties.definition: A link to a resource representing the person or the group to whom the medication will be given.
properties.comment: SubstanceAdministration->subject->Patient.

properties.name: context
properties.definition: The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this event.

properties.name: supportingInformation
properties.short: Information that supports the dispensing of the medication
properties.definition: Additional information that supports the medication being dispensed.

properties.name: performer
properties.definition: Indicates who or what performed the event.

properties.name: id
properties.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

properties.name: extension
properties.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: modifierExtension
properties.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
properties.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: function
properties.short: Who performed the dispense and what they did
properties.definition: Distinguishes the type of performer in the dispense.  For example, date enterer, packager, final checker.

properties.name: actor
properties.definition: The device, practitioner, etc. who performed the action.  It should be assumed that the actor is the dispenser of the medication.

properties.name: location
properties.definition: The principal physical location where the dispense was performed.

properties.name: authorizingPrescription
properties.short: Medication order that authorizes the dispense
properties.definition: Indicates the medication order that is being dispensed against.
properties.comment: Maps to basedOn in Event logical model.

properties.name: type
properties.short: Trial fill, partial fill, emergency fill, etc.
properties.definition: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. For example, Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

properties.name: quantity
properties.definition: The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.

properties.name: daysSupply
properties.short: Amount of medication expressed as a timing amount
properties.definition: The amount of medication expressed as a timing amount.

properties.name: whenPrepared
properties.short: When product was packaged and reviewed
properties.definition: The time when the dispensed product was packaged and reviewed.

properties.name: whenHandedOver
properties.definition: The time the dispensed product was provided to the patient or their representative.

properties.name: destination
properties.definition: Identification of the facility/location where the medication was shipped to, as part of the dispense event.

properties.name: receiver
properties.definition: Identifies the person who picked up the medication.  This will usually be a patient or their caregiver, but some cases exist where it can be a healthcare professional.

properties.name: note
properties.definition: Extra information about the dispense that could not be conveyed in the other attributes.

properties.name: dosageInstruction
properties.short: How the medication is to be used by the patient or administered by the caregiver
properties.definition: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.
properties.comment: When the dose or rate is intended to change over the entire administration period (e.g. Tapering dose prescriptions), multiple instances of dosage instructions will need to be supplied to convey the different doses/rates.The pharmacist reviews the medication order prior to dispense and updates the dosageInstruction based on the actual product being dispensed.

properties.name: substitution
properties.short: Whether a substitution was performed on the dispense
properties.definition: Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense.  In some cases, substitution will be expected but does not happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen.  This block explains what substitution did or did not happen and why.  If nothing is specified, substitution was not done.

properties.name: id
properties.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

properties.name: extension
properties.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: modifierExtension
properties.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
properties.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: wasSubstituted
properties.short: Whether a substitution was or was not performed on the dispense
properties.definition: True if the dispenser dispensed a different drug or product from what was prescribed.

properties.name: type
properties.short: Code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed
properties.definition: A code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed.

properties.name: reason
properties.definition: Indicates the reason for the substitution (or lack of substitution) from what was prescribed.

properties.name: responsibleParty
properties.short: Who is responsible for the substitution
properties.definition: The person or organization that has primary responsibility for the substitution.

properties.name: detectedIssue
properties.definition: Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. drug-drug interaction, duplicate therapy, dosage alert etc.
properties.comment: This element can include a detected issue that has been identified either by a decision support system or by a clinician and may include information on the steps that were taken to address the issue.

properties.name: eventHistory
properties.short: A list of relevant lifecycle events
properties.definition: A summary of the events of interest that have occurred, such as when the dispense was verified.
properties.comment: This might not include provenances for all versions of the request – only those deemed “relevant” or important. This SHALL NOT include the Provenance associated with this current version of the resource. (If that provenance is deemed to be a “relevant” change, it will need to be added as part of a later update. Until then, it can be queried directly as the Provenance that points to this version using _revinclude All Provenances should have some historical version of this Request as their subject.).

searchParameters.name: code
searchParameters.description: Returns dispenses of this medicine code

searchParameters.name: identifier
searchParameters.description: Returns dispenses with this external identifier

searchParameters.name: patient
searchParameters.description: The identity of a patient to list dispenses  for

searchParameters.name: medication
searchParameters.description: Returns dispenses of this medicine resource

searchParameters.name: status
searchParameters.description: Returns dispenses with a specified dispense status

searchParameters.name: context
searchParameters.description: Returns dispenses with a specific context (episode or episode of care)

searchParameters.name: destination
searchParameters.description: Returns dispenses that should be sent to a specific destination

searchParameters.name: performer
searchParameters.description: Returns dispenses performed by a specific individual

searchParameters.name: prescription
searchParameters.description: The identity of a prescription to list dispenses from

searchParameters.name: receiver
searchParameters.description: The identity of a receiver to list dispenses for

searchParameters.name: responsibleparty
searchParameters.description: Returns dispenses with the specified responsible party

searchParameters.name: subject
searchParameters.description: The identity of a patient for whom to list dispenses

searchParameters.name: type
searchParameters.description: Returns dispenses of a specific type

searchParameters.name: whenhandedover
searchParameters.description: Returns dispenses handed over on this date

searchParameters.name: whenprepared
searchParameters.description: Returns dispenses prepared on this date
